str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From sun and echo; to hold together, i.e. To compress or arrest; figuratively, to compel, perplex, afflict, preoccupy.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Then, therefore, since. Probably from airo; a particle denoting an inference more or less decisive.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
